Datatable:
+10 [industryColored] per Anomaly on System
Ancient Knowledge Your civilization has already explored the galaxy, now all that is left is to take it. Reveals all Solar Systems in the Galaxy
Well Founded Your civilization has already expended the resources to explore their constellation, but now they can finally explore it. Reveals all Nodes in Starting Constellation
Lost Refuge With an extragalactic knowledge of where all the true landmarks of the galaxy are, finding a place to hide or escape to has never been easier. Reveals all Special Nodes in the Galaxy
Predator Natural instincts make it easy to determine roughly where your prey lay. Reveals all the location of all Home Systems in the Galaxy
May not build Colony Ships May not occupy Conquered Territory
State Administration As a result of its history of decentralized government, this faction is incapable of enforcing much in the way of empire-wide legislation.
Core Administration This faction strives for centralized government and can more easily maintain empire-wide legislation.
Scavengers Code Honor among scavengers lives on in a tradition of political compromise. Provides military-focused economic bonuses based off of the leading political party: -25% Retrofit and Repair [dustColored] Costs (Industrialists) +20 [scienceColored] per CP Destroyed in Friendly Territory (Scientists) +20 [dustColored] per CP Destroyed in Friendly Territory (Pacifists) +5 [happinessColored] on Systems per Owned Admiral in Friendly Territory (Ecologists) +10 [prestigeColored] per CP Destroyed in Friendly Territory (Religious) +20 [manpower] per CP Destroyed in Friendly Territory (Militarists) -25% Retrofit and Repair [dustColored] Costs +35 [scienceColored] per CP Destroyed in Friendly Territory +35 [dustColored] per CP Destroyed in Friendly Territory +5 [happinessColored] on Systems per Owned Admiral in Friendly Territory +25 [prestigeColored] per CP Destroyed in Friendly Territory +20 [manpower] per CP Destroyed in Friendly Territory
Anti-Expansionists A history of defensive warfare has taught your Empire's citizens to be wary of spreading too thin, and grow anxious when their Empire grows. -25% Base Overcolonization Cap (Rounded up) -50% Base Overcolonization Cap (Rounded up)
Greener Pastures Your empire knows how to make it's cities look beautiful, and alongside a bustling tourism industry, many tourists even end up immigrating.
Cheats Displays traits that have game-breaking effects #FF0000#+10 Points#REVERT# #FF0000#+50 Points#REVERT# #FF0000#+100 Points#REVERT# #FF0000#+500 Points#REVERT# #FF0000#+1000 Points#REVERT# Someone is a big cheater! These traits increase the amount of points you can use for custom factions.
Generate at least $ScienceAmoutName Science for $TurnsAmoutName Turns through any means You can find new Relics or remove Relics from Heroes to increase your Science production, as well as build improvements or enter science agreements with other factions Planets do not generate Science. Cannot obtain Technology from other empires. Temple in the Empire -50% [FIDS] on Planet +10 [prestigeColored] per [population] +5 [prestigeColored] per [population] on Cold +1 Population Slot +4 [scienceColored] per [relic] +1 [scienceColored] per [relic] per Fertile
Dust-to-Motion Physics While Dust is used to "motivate" planetary economies for a project, it also directly fuels various machines and (more dangerously) dust-enhanced individuals below the Academies notice. Joint research projects with the Academy (and plausibly deniable labs among it's citizen-staff) have allowed us to improve both of these methods, frontloading our costs to save time and Dust over mundane labor. Dust-to-Motion Physics While Dust is used to "motivate" planetary economies for a project, it also directly fuels various machines and (more dangerously) dust-enhanced individuals below the Academies notice. Joint research projects with the Academy (and plausibly deniable labs among it's citizen-staff) have allowed us to improve both of these methods, frontloading our costs to save time and Dust over mundane labor. Single-Project Economies Modern building projects are more vast than ever in our empire, but in turn are less locally useful than ever, requiring serious convincing for even planetary executives. By investing in firms and entangling them with the success of larger imperial projects, we can create an economy which has been subtly shifted towards construction as it's end goal, and slowly turn the populace to worry about it as their signature export, reducing costs. Single-Project Economies Modern building projects are more vast than ever in our empire, but in turn are less locally useful than ever, requiring serious convincing for even planetary executives. By investing in firms and entangling them with the success of larger imperial projects, we can create an economy which has been subtly shifted towards construction as it's end goal, and slowly turn the populace to worry about it as their signature export, reducing costs.
Advanced Empire Laws Increasing government competence at data collection and professionalization enables passage of additional laws.
Pork Barrel Payouts Those who control the government are able to use the coffers of the state to curry favor with local communities. Bills peddled as "aid" will instead be used to further a political agenda, driving up local support. Unlocks Propaganda for Parties represented in the Senate Firehose of Falsity A series of galactic government-sponsored broadcasts are prepared, meticulously designed to incite a strong feeling of patriotism in every citizen. While initially the broadcasts might not seem effective, over time, the populace will grow to accept them. Unlocks Propaganda for all Parties
+10 [manpower] on Systems (Vanilla) +15 [manpower] on Systems (Rework) +15 [systemdefense] on Systems (Rework) +400 [systemdefense] Capacity on Systems (Rework)
+40 [systemdefense] Capacity per [population] on Systems (Rework) +3 [manpower] per [population] on Systems (Rework)
+5% [manpower] per System Level on Systems (Vanilla) +40% x GameSpeed [manpower] per System Level on Systems (Rework)
+5% [fids] per System Level on Systems (Vanilla) +7.5% [foodColored] per System Level on Systems (Rework) +7.5% [industryColored] per System Level on Systems (Rework)
150% to all System Development upgrade effects on System (Vanilla) +7.5% [dustColored] per System Level on Systems (Rework) +7.5% [scienceColored] per System Level on Systems (Rework)
Ship Design Rewards Enabling this will allow you to unlock other faction's hull designs from certain quests. True You will unlock other faction's hull designs from certain quests. False You won't unlock other faction's hull designs from certain quests. Enable Law Rework Enabling this will use the ESG reworked laws True Uses ESG expanded and rebalanced laws False Uses vanilla laws Collection Bonus Laws Enabling this unlocks laws gained from collection bonuses, disabling this will give you the effect as a faction trait, and not require you to enact it as a law Laws When you receive a law from a collection bonus, you will have to enact the law to get any bonus. Trait When you receive a law from a collection bonus, the effect will be immediately applied, and no law will be required.
By applying governmental pressure to banks and cleverly manipulating interest rates, key actors are able to influence the global inflation rate of the empire, at least for a time. This requires significant political influence, obviously, as the Families have a tight grip on these matters. (Inflation Minimum: 1.0x)
Exploratory Non-Detection Systems The ability to explore unhindered is a core part of our expansion, a necessity for planning and directing both colony ships and conquering fleets. While we could never afford to do this for larger or more common ships, we can outfit our Explorers with advanced passive cloaking systems such as foils, exotic material mirrors, and radar-haze exhausts so that neither pirates nor pesky sovereign borders can keep us from charting everything!
--> Poacher Your empire has a.. gift for knowing where feeble empires are located, but who knows you'll do with this information. Reveals all Minor Factions in the Galaxy
All the [industryColored] is consumed. 75% [industryColored] converted into [dustColored] All the [industryColored] is consumed. 100% [industryColored] converted into [dustColored] All the [industryColored] is consumed. 50% [industryColored] converted into [dustColored] All the [industryColored] is consumed. 100% [industryColored] converted into [scienceColored] All the [industryColored] is consumed. 75% [industryColored] converted into [scienceColored] All the [industryColored] is consumed. 50% [industryColored] converted into [scienceColored]
Natural Camouflage This ship can innately cloak its entire fleet at Cloak Level 1 without any additional modules. +10% Ship Health, +10% Shield Capacity, and +10% Defense on Plating and Shields
+1 Resource generation on T1 Strategic Deposits on System Level 2 +1 Resource generation on T2 Strategic Deposits on System Level 3 +1 Resource generation on T3 Strategic Deposits on System Level 4
+10 [happinessColored] on Systems while under the Colonization Threshold
+3.5% [foodColored] per [population] in Home System on all Systems, including Sanctuaries
Portal Testing Center Vaulters are accustomed to overcoming hardships and turning lemons into lemonade. Through extensive and dangerous testing, populations with access to metafolding portals become more scientifically productive Portal Enrichment Center Metafolding portals designed for other applications have proven to be invaluable for other forms of scientific research and testing, including advancing an understanding of the laws of physics and conservation of momentum
Pre-Planned Unpacking Our first settlements were plagued by disorganization and the struggle to sort damaged equipment from that which survived the long journey. By taking inventory and refurbishing certain Argosy systems with a team of volunteers, future settlements can be created far more smoothly. +10% [FIDS] while under the Colonization Threshold Automated Prefabs While the majority of Vaulter equipment on the Argosy was built with traditional Aurigan techniques (and obsolete Aurigan technology), new manufacturing methods and foldable prefab buildings will allow future colonists to step out of the Argosy and directly into the automated core of their new home. +15% [FIDS] while under the Colonization Threshold
Dubious Breeders I Due to a limited understanding of the reproductive mechanisms of the minor populations that they oversee, breeding programs are less efficient than one would otherwise expect +100 [foodcolored] required to grow a unit of [population] (Scales with Game Speed) Dubious Breeders II Due to a limited understanding of the reproductive mechanisms of the minor populations that they oversee, breeding programs are less efficient than one would otherwise expect +200 [foodcolored] required to grow a unit of [population] (Scales with Game Speed)
Ghost Crew Due to their ethereal nature, the spectral crews of ghost ships are both less present on their material ships and highly resistant to physical damage -80% base [manpower] on ships, and 95% resistance to crew damage from boarding pods and weapons
No automatic shipments of [foodcolored] to outposts, but ability to add +10 [foodcolored] at outposts without shipments from a colony
This ship cannot be retrofitted
An AI that allows you to play freely. Human Players get: • +2 [fidsi] per [population] • +20 [happinessColored] on Systems • +2 Overcolonization Threshold • -20% Overpopulation [happinessColored] penalties • -20% [dustColored] upkeep • +10% [hackingSpeed] • +40 [processingPower] It's like you have guns, and they have sticks. Human Players get: • +1 [fidsi] per [population] • +10 [happinessColored] on Systems • +1 Overcolonization Threshold • -10% Overpopulation [happinessColored] penalties • -10% [dustColored] upkeep • +5% [hackingSpeed] • +20 [processingPower] It’s like you have guns, and they have guns. Neither the AI nor Human players get any bonuses. It’s like you have guns, and they have better guns. AI Players get: • +1 [fidsi] and +1 an additional [prestigeColored] per [population] • +20 [happinessColored] on Systems • -10% Overcolonization [happinessColored] penalties • -10% Overpopulation [happinessColored] penalties • -10% [dustColored] upkeep • +1 Maximum Behemoth • +10 [processingPower] • -50% Treaty [prestigeColored] upkeep It’s like you have guns, and they have tanks. AI Players get: • +2 [fidsi] and an additional +1.5 [prestigeColored] per [population] • +20 [happinessColored] on Systems • -20% Overcolonization [happinessColored] penalties • -20% Overpopulation [happinessColored] penalties • -20% [dustColored] upkeep • +2 Maximum Behemoths • +20 [processingPower] • -50% Treaty [prestigeColored] upkeep It’s like you have guns, and they have nuclear weapons systems that can track your biometrics. AI Players get: • +3 [fidsi] and an additional +1.5 [prestigeColored] per [population] • +40 [happinessColored] on Systems • -40% Overcolonization [happinessColored] penalties • -40% Overpopulation [happinessColored] penalties • -40% [dustColored] upkeep • +3 Maximum Behemoths • +30 [processingPower] • -50% Treaty [prestigeColored] upkeep You shall not pass! AI Players get: • +4 [fidsi] and an additional +1.5 [prestigeColored] per [population] • +60 [happinessColored] on Systems • -60% Overcolonization [happinessColored] penalties • -60% Overpopulation [happinessColored] penalties • -60% [dustColored] upkeep • +4 Maximum Behemoths • 40 [processingPower] • -50% Treaty [prestigeColored] upkeep • x2 [systemdefense] Capacity

Manpower Deployment on Fleets +60% Manpower Deployment on Fleets +1% [FIDS] per 500 [systemdefense] on System, up to 25% +1.5% [FIDS] per 500 [systemdefense] on System, up to 30%
YIMBY! Preemption of Local Zoning and Building Code Restrictions By overruling obstructionist NIMBY policies of local governments, imperial authorities are able to accelerate development with significantly fewer resources
Probe Deep Prophylactic Reconnaissance Observing Biological Entities: Deploying Extraterrestrial Exploration Probes and Harvesting All Relevant Data The exploration of the galaxy is a very important and exciting opportunity for the scientific wing of your empire. It is also, unfortunately, a costly and time-consuming affair. This piece of legislature assigns research teams to the task of probe technology development. There are still shortcuts can be found in the manufacturing process, and by employing this knowledge exploration fleets can discover more while using less. x1.5 Vision Range on Ships and Probes x1.5 Probe Lifetime Doubled Probe Restock Speed x2 Vision Range on Ships and Probes x2 Probe Lifetime Tripled Probe Restock Speed
Consumer Applications Research Framework for Consumer Spinoffs Every technological advance has potential consumer applications, if given the necessary access and attention from the private sector. By setting up a series of government-sponsored spinoff incubators, this initiative ensures that new discoveries are brought to consumers as rapidly as possible Consumer Applications
Make Trade Not War Profitable Cessation of Hostile Actions Complex trade supply-chains are much more lucrative and successful when they can avoid capitalizing high risk premiums into their transaction costs due to a reduced threat of wartime disruption
Blood From Stones Edict Holy Decree Authorizing Pilgrimage To the Firmament As taught by religious leaders since the earliest days of the empire, the stars hold untold treasures and knowledge, and are destined to belong to your people alone. Seen by some as a new form of tithing, this law authorizes heroes to send fleets on pilgrimages to wondrous nodes throughout the galaxy for the purposes of exploration and revelation. Such fleets often return coated in dust, with crews touched by divine inspiration.
Charitable Champions Act Divine Framework for Heroic Almsgiving Through aggressive teachings of the sacred nature of Dust and its history, each Hero learns to view Dust as the holy artifact it is, and lining the empire's coffers becomes a task of religous importance.
Canned Grunts Regulatory Act for Rotating Cryosleep and Expanded Naval Psychological Support Orbital marines have simultaneously the most glorious and boring posts in our military, marked by long periods of silent discomfort in a cramped metal tube and short bursts of unimaginable terror and destruction on alien worlds. While indefinite icing has proven to make the battles more mentally straining, a rotating schedule of light cryosleep has allowed us to fit more soldiers into ships, while releasing just a few at a time into a far more spacious controlled environment with entertainment and psychological support far better than normal shore-leave.
New Deal Economy Jumpstart and Stimulus Bill In truth, this bill is not a single law, but a small collection of new regulations, economic and social relief programs, and tax amendments with the aim of galvanizing a beleaguered workforce. A feeling of sweeping economic change motivates workers to rise up, but as the novelty wears off and corporations find new ways to sidestep these regulations, enthusiasm wanes.
Information Economy Stimulus Through Innovation Protocol In contrast to the more industrial ages of eons past and their focus on the manufacturing of goods, post-scientific revolution economics revolve around knowledge of the economy and the ability to apply that knowledge. By educating economic elites on the intricacies of understanding and manipulating an electronic market, profit margins rise across the board. In turn, this increased education of powerful figures leads to greater scientific innovation.
Tested Patience Act Clarification on Foreign Misunderstanding of Our Abilities Warmongers have often misunderstood unwillingness to use violence for inability, and on many occasions have been swiftly corrected on the matter. With this law we hope to correct our enemies in much the same way, using simulations and advanced implants to create a generation of officers with an enhanced capacity for naval tactics, and the necessary mental safeguards to never use them offensively or retain the information once the implants are removed.
Roughing It Curriculum Adjustment in Favor of Planetary Engagement While many societies have optional classes or clubs to teach ecological basics, the ability to creatively interface with the environment for study, food, or materials is often lacking. In order to ensure long term ecological stability, planetary education must be expanded from a hobby to a course load, ranging from sand-worm watching field trips for children to intensive fieldwork in areas like xenobiology, hollow-world fungal food systems, and geothermal "volcanic metallurgy" in college. +75% Initial Planet [FIDS] +125% Initial Planet [FIDS]
Arborous Armor Program Public Planting of Special Specimens with Military Applications Act The creation of "self-sealing" materials to protect ships has been understood since long before we left our home system, but it has always been too expensive or slow for use in stellar battlefields, restricted only to satellites or science drones. However, genetically modified plants can be distributed to the public to cheaply and sustainably mass produce a sap which achieves even greater effects, requiring only regular pickup by the government to keep ships well supplied with these amber defenses.
Deific Oversight Act Justification For Holy Governmental Reform Through reinterpretations of ancient scriptures, the case can be made that the empire has fallen into a state of blasphemous disrepair, and that an increase in reverence is necessary for societal enlightenment. Heroes are deployed to systems to instruct wayward congregations how to devote themselves towards self-betterment and righteous causes. Graduates of this program lead ascetic and pious lives, and encourage their neighbors to follow in their footsteps. +20% [fids] on Systems with Governors +30% [fids] on Systems with Governors
Heroic Warriors Righteous and Unimpeachable Edict of Holy Warfare Through religious ceremonies of great import, Heroes may attempt to teach subordinates in the intricacies of Dust manipulation. The exercise nevertheless provides insight into the Hero's decision-making and grants an air of divine significance to their commands. Crews come to believe there could be no cause more righteous than that which they fight for. This ultimately results in more alert and precise fleets that battle with peerless discipline.
Labor Corps Program Orders to Expand Soldier Duties to Minimize Economic Loss One of the weaknesses of many militarized societies is the dormant labor of soldiers on duty, and industries turned from growth to munitions, representing a net loss for society. By merging defence forces with unions or guilds to create controlled militia, investing in the flexibility of manufacturers, implementing military job training programs, and shortening the minimum tour of duty, this weakness can be entirely reversed during peacetime, and strongly mitigated during war.
Species Stability Act Command for the Restriction of Demographic Variability With enough support, carefully presented data and appeals to the national mythology can help to pass a most controversial law: that only the primary species of the empire be allowed to grow. All other species, whatever their breeding habits, are permitted to retain their current population under a one-to-one offspring fiat enforced by new surveillance agencies, while the original species is encouraged to grow. Only your Original Empire Population can increase -1 [happinessColored] per Foreign Population on Systems -0.5 [happinessColored] per Foreign Population on Systems
Species Resilience Act Plan to Stabilize Galactic Survival It has been well known for centuries that genetic diversity ensures someone, somewhere is going to survive any given event, and total annihilation of the population is less and less likely. Applied to a multi-species society, this means that it is best to retool public programs for alien needs, and focus them on the smallest groups first to ensure long term resilience to harm. Only Foreign Populations can increase -1 [happinessColored] per Original Empire Population on Systems -0.5 [happinessColored] per Original Empire Population on Systems
Tier 1 and 2 Luxury Development Effect Tier 3 Luxury Development Effect Fleet Upkeep This is a collection bonus law! You are already gaining the effect, and do not need to pass it.
+0.1% [fidsi] on Systems per Major Population in Empire
#6FCDE2#Pacifist#REVERT# #6FCDE2#Impassive#REVERT# #6FCDE2#Vengeful#REVERT# #6FCDE2#Mercantile#REVERT# #6FCDE2#Isolationist#REVERT# #6FCDE2#Cruel#REVERT# #6FCDE2#Restless#REVERT# #6FCDE2#Innovative#REVERT# #6FCDE2#Benevolent#REVERT# #6FCDE2#Greedy#REVERT# #6FCDE2#Renegade#REVERT# #6FCDE2#Paragon#REVERT# #6FCDE2#Militarist#REVERT# #6FCDE2#Neutral#REVERT# This trait affects the playstyle of assigned Empire while under the control of AI Personality Trait Technology Trait
-50% Diplomatic Pressure against your Empire No [OverPopulation] penalty on Systems, +20% [foodColored] to [manpower] conversion +20% Ownership recovery rate on Systems -30% Empire Development [scienceColored] Cost +10% [dustColored] per Empires at Peace -50% [OverColonization] on Systems +5 [happinessColored] per System Level on Systems, +1 [happinessColored] per [population] on Systems Provides the location of every fleet on the map +0.1 [scienceColored] per [industryColored] on Systems +50% Deposit Value on Strategic Resources +10% Troop Health during Invasion per Peace, +15% Troop Health during Invasion per Alliance -20% Population [foodColored] upkeep +25% [manpower] replenishment on fleets outside borders 0% [fidsi] Penalty from Blockades +50% Deposit Value on Luxury Resources +5% [fids] per Fertile Planet on Systems +0.25 [move] on Ships per Systems on Empire -10% System Improvement [industryColored] cost per Luxury Deposit on Systems +1% Technology Cost Reduction per Strategic Deposit on Empire +5 [happinessColored] per Strategic Deposit on System +5% [prestigeColored] per War +20% [processingPower] on Empire +50% [dustColored] on Systems with Unique Planets +1% [foodColored] on Systems per Sterile Planet on Empire +35% Troop Health during Ground Battles "Blessings and Bandages" Law Unlocked (+35% Troop Health during Ground Battles)
"Crack Squads" Law Unlocked (+2 Systems occupied before triggering expansion disapproval) "Symbiotic Living" Law Unlocked (+3% [honorColored] gains after battles per System Level on Systems) "Happy Harmonies" Law Unlocked (+2% [honorColored] gains after battles per Strategic Deposit on Systems) "Happy Sardines" Law Unlocked (+20% [foodColored] to [manpower])
+2 Systems occupied before triggering expansion disapproval +3% [honorColored] gains after battles per System Level on Systems +2% [honorColored] gains after battles per Strategic Deposit on Systems +20% [foodColored] to [manpower]
Divine Indifference Virtual Endless have little concern for the affairs of mortal planetary inhabitants, resulting in lower attention to planetary yields -25% [FIDS] and Disapproval from Initial Planet Values

Starts the game with a Super Colonizer ship on the Special Node "Rejuvenation Field" +1 Movement Point on Cryogenic Colonizer
+100% [prestigeColored] on Law Upkeep Cost +5% [fidsi] on Every System per Empires at War +10 [happinessColored] on Every System per Empires at War
Thick fur or cozy sleeping habits have made this species poorly suited to hot environs, whether they are forced to regularly shave their coats or learn to dread sleeping too close to their partners. Cold blood or hairless bodies have made this species poorly suited to the cold, as they struggle to stay awake as torpor calls to them or resist the urge to fight one another when trapped indoors by inclement weather. This species adapted to float eternally upon wind currents and layers of pressurized gas, and so finds planets with a comparatively minor atmosphere dreadful, whether due to the new threat of hitting something if they fall or the claustrophobic feeling of one direction being restricted by a vast wall.
Ravenous Consumers I Due to unusual differences in internal filtering systems or historical substance use, even this species luxuries of choice are weak and ineffective without using an economically straining dosage. Ravenous Consumers II Due to unusual differences in internal filtering systems or historical substance use, even this species luxuries of choice are weak and ineffective without using an economically straining dosage.
Use [dustColored] to colonize instead of colonizers Can negotiate/trade outposts using diplomacy No automatic shipment of food to outposts Can use [prestigeColored] to boost outpost food production Starts with the ability to buyout construction, with a 15% [dustColored] discount
Starting Ships: 2x [explorer]
